titleStmt.title: The Dutchess of Portsmouths farewel: the Dutchess holds a dialogue, yea, doth relate the wretched state, and talks with Madam Gwin; that now she liveth in. To the tune of, Tan tarra rara tan tivee.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for I. Clarke, W. Thackeray, and T. passinger [sic],

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "I Prithee dear Portsmouth now tell my thy mind ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
